title: CNN debate's imposing lanky awkward gothic
content:
It calls out to me

[http://i.a.cnn.net/cnn/2008/images/02/20/220x168%20Clinton%20Obama.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045452/http:/i.a.cnn.net/cnn/2008/images/02/20/220x168%20Clinton%20Obama.jpg "http://i.a.cnn.net/cnn/2008/images/02/20/220x168%20Clinton%20Obama.jpg")

 [‹ Wedding invitation fancy script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045452/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48759 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help with these two typefaces please ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045452/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48772 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roquestrew

comments.content:
I apologize for my small image, but if you guys tune into CNN tonight, for the big graphics on Wolf Blitzer’s surface-computer display, you can see this typeface in use; it’s very Alternate Gothic-ish but stranger, more orthogonal

for instance, the R’s bowl is basically a box and the tail is a vertical line, more or less; the M is weirdly wide, not compact at all
